boardgame.description: What do bored English noblemen do with their free time? Well, according to this Spiel des Jahres (1990) winner by Klaus Teuber, they like collecting old junk and then showing it off. Players buy or steal various pieces of junk in the form of cards, trying to form the largest and oldest collection. Built on a 'rock-paper-scissors' mechanism, this game gives all players a couple of choices each turn. The trick is in guessing what your opponents are likely to do, and planning your choice accordingly_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;only after everyone's decision is revealed do you know for certain whether you made the right one._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Note: Hoity Toity (Uberplay, 2004) is for 3 to 6 players._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Spionage! (G_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp;RRR, 1992) is for 2 to 5 players_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Shipping to any U.S. address $12.00 What do bored English noblemen do with their free time? Well, according to this Spiel des Jahres (1990) winner by Klaus Teuber, they like collecting old junk and then showing it off. Players buy or steal various pieces of junk in the form of cards, trying to form the largest and oldest collection. Built on a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;rock-paper-scissors_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; mechanism, this game gives all players a couple of choices each turn. The trick is in guessing what your opponents are likely to do, and planning your choice accordingly -- only after everyone_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s decision is revealed do you know for certain whether you made the right one.
